title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
text: BrazilDataAPI package provides unified interface access open data BrasilAPI REST Countries API, focus Brazil. allows users easily retrieve --date information postal codes, banks, economic indicators, holidays, company registrations, international country-level data relevant Brazil. addition API-access functions, package includes collection curated datasets related Brazil, covering diverse domains demographics (male female population state year), river levels Manaus, environmental emission factors São Paulo, Brazilian film festivals, historical yellow fever outbreaks. BrazilDataAPI designed support research, teaching, data analysis focused Brazil integrating public RESTful APIs high-quality, domain-specific datasets single, easy--use R package.

title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
text: BrazilDataAPI package provides several core functions access real-time structured information Brazil public APIs BrasilAPI REST Countries. list main functions included package: get_brazil_banks(): Get List Banks Brazil get_brazil_cep(): Get Address Information Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) Example: get_brazil_cep(“89010025”) get_brazil_cnpj(): Get Company Information CNPJ (Brazil) Example: get_brazil_cnpj(“19131243000197”) get_brazil_municipalities(): Get Municipalities Brazilian State IBGE Example: get_brazil_municipalities(“SP”) get_brazil_rate_name(): Get Specific Brazilian Economic Rate Name Example: get_brazil_rate_name(“CDI”) get_brazil_rates(): Get Official Interest Rates Indexes Brazil get_brazil_vehicle_brands(): Get Vehicle Brands BrasilAPI (FIPE Data) Example: get_brazil_vehicle_brands(“motos”),get_brazil_vehicle_brands(“caminhoes”) get_country_info(): Get essential information Brazil country full name Example: get_country_info(“Brazil”),get_country_info(“brazil”),get_country_info(“Peru”) view_datasets_BrazilDataAPI(): Lists curated datasets included BrazilDataAPI package functions allow users access high-quality structured information Brazil, can combined tools like dplyr, tidyr, ggplot2 support wide range data analysis visualization tasks. following sections, ’ll find examples work BrazilDataAPI practical scenarios.

what: List official interest rates and indexes from the BrasilAPI
title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # Retrieves official interest rates and indexes from the BrazilAPI  brazil_rates_001 <- get_brazil_rates()  print(brazil_rates_001) #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   nome  valor #>   <chr> <dbl> #> 1 Selic 15    #> 2 CDI   14.9  #> 3 IPCA   5.32

what: Get Vehicle Brands from BrasilAPI (FIPE Data)
title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # A string indicating the type of vehicle. Must be one of "carros", "motos", or "caminhoes".  brazil_vehicles <- get_brazil_vehicle_brands("motos")  print(brazil_vehicles) #> # A tibble: 94 × 2 #>    nome     valor #>    <chr>    <chr> #>  1 ADLY     60    #>  2 AGRALE   61    #>  3 APRILIA  62    #>  4 ATALA    63    #>  5 BAJAJ    64    #>  6 BETA     65    #>  7 BIMOTA   66    #>  8 BMW      67    #>  9 BRANDY   68    #> 10 byCristo 69    #> # ℹ 84 more rows

what: Get Municipalities of a Brazilian State
title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # A two-letter string representing the Brazilian state abbreviation (e.g., "SP", "RJ", "BA").  brazil_Municipalities <- get_brazil_municipalities("SP")  print(brazil_Municipalities) #> # A tibble: 645 × 2 #>    nome                   codigo_ibge #>    <chr>                  <chr>       #>  1 ADAMANTINA             3500105     #>  2 ADOLFO                 3500204     #>  3 AGUAÍ                  3500303     #>  4 ÁGUAS DA PRATA         3500402     #>  5 ÁGUAS DE LINDÓIA       3500501     #>  6 ÁGUAS DE SANTA BÁRBARA 3500550     #>  7 ÁGUAS DE SÃO PEDRO     3500600     #>  8 AGUDOS                 3500709     #>  9 ALAMBARI               3500758     #> 10 ALFREDO MARCONDES      3500808     #> # ℹ 635 more rows

what: Female Deaths by Age Group in Brazil
title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # Summarize total deaths by age and year df_plot <- Brasil_females_df %>%   group_by(year1, age) %>%   summarise(total_deaths = sum(deaths, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")  # Plot: Deaths by age group over time ggplot(df_plot, aes(x = age, y = total_deaths, color = as.factor(year1))) +   geom_line(size = 1) +   labs(     title = "Female Deaths by Age Group in Brazil",     subtitle = "Aggregated by year (year1)",     x = "Age",     y = "Number of Deaths",     color = "Year"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 14),     legend.position = "bottom"   )

title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
text: dataset BrazilDataAPI labeled suffix indicate structure type: _df: standard data frame. _ts: time series object. _list: list object.

title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
text: addition API access functions, BrazilDataAPI provides several preloaded datasets offering insights Brazil’s demographic structure, environmental conditions, cultural events, public health records. featured examples: Brasil_females_df: Brazilian Female Demographics & Mortality data frame containing population counts mortality information females Brazil, disaggregated federal states abridged age groups, years 1991 2000. manaus_ts: Monthly Average Heights Rio Negro Manaus univariate time series monthly average river heights Rio Negro Manaus. series contains 1080 observations spanning 90 years, January 1903 December 1992. Yellow_Fever_list: Yellow Fever Outbreak Brazil list object containing information flow Yellow Fever cases five Brazilian states outbreak period December 2016 May 2017.

title: BrazilDataAPI: Access Brazilian Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
text: BrazilDataAPI package provides robust set tools access open data Brazil RESTful APIs curated datasets. includes functions retrieve information postal codes, banks, economic rates, company registrations via BrasilAPI, well international country indicators REST Countries API. Additionally, offers preloaded datasets Brazil’s male female population state year, film festivals, São Paulo’s emission factors, river data Manaus, records yellow fever outbreaks.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Renzo Caceres Rossi. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation

Brasil_females_df: Brazilian Female Demographics & Mortality data frame containing population counts mortality information females Brazil, disaggregated federal states abridged age groups, years 1991 2000. manaus_ts: Monthly Average Heights Rio Negro Manaus univariate time series monthly average river heights Rio Negro Manaus. series contains 1080 observations spanning 90 years, January 1903 December 1992. Yellow_Fever_list: Yellow Fever Outbreak Brazil list object containing information flow Yellow Fever cases five Brazilian states outbreak period December 2016 May 2017.

title: Access Brazilian Economic, Demographic, Environmental, and Geopolitical Data via RESTful APIs and Curated Datasets
code: # Load the package library(BrazilDataAPI)  # Selected, essential information about Brazil get_country_info()  # Get List of Banks in Brazil get_brazil_banks()  # Load a dataset data("Brasil_females_df")  # Shows six rows of the dataset head(Brasil_females_df)  # Display the structure of the dataset str(Brasil_females_df)  # Shows the whole dataset  View(Brasil_females_df)

title: Brazilian Female Demographics & Mortality (1991-2000) — Brasil_females_df
text: dataset, Brasil_females_df, data frame containing population counts mortality information females Brazil, disaggregated federal states abridged age groups, years 1991 2000. dataset includes 486 observations 8 variables. Population counts reported years, deaths given average counts intercensal period. Age groups follow pattern 0, 1, 5, ..., 75, open age group 80+. total 53 Brazilian states represented.

title: Brazilian Female Demographics & Mortality (1991-2000) — Brasil_females_df
Brazilian Female Demographics & Mortality (1991-2000) — Brasil_females_df
text: data frame 486 observations 8 variables: cod Integer code identifying federal state pop1 Population count 1991 (integer) pop2 Population count 2000 (integer) deaths Average number deaths intercensal period (numeric) year1 First census year (1991; integer) year2 Second census year (2000; integer) age Abridged age group (integer values like 0, 1, 5, ..., 75; open age group 80) sex Sex identifier; values "f" (character)

title: Brazilian Female Demographics & Mortality (1991-2000) — Brasil_females_df
text: Data taken DDM package version 1.0-0

title: Brazilian Female Demographics & Mortality (1991-2000) — Brasil_females_df
text: dataset name kept 'Brasil_females_df' avoid confusion datasets R ecosystem. naming convention helps distinguish dataset part BrazilDataAPI package assists users identifying specific characteristics. suffix 'df' indicates dataset data frame. original content modified way.

Population counts reported years, deaths given average counts intercensal period. Age groups follow pattern 0, 1, 5, ..., 75, open age group 80+. total 53 Brazilian states represented.

what: Get List of Banks in Brazil — get_brazil_banks
title: Get List of Banks in Brazil — get_brazil_banks
text: function retrieves list banks Brazil BrasilAPI endpoint: `https://brasilapi.com.br/api/banks/v1`. response includes key details bank code, name, ISPB (identificador sistema de pagamentos).

title: Get List of Banks in Brazil — get_brazil_banks
Get List of Banks in Brazil — get_brazil_banks
text: tibble (data frame) following columns: code: Bank code (integer). name: Short name bank. fullName: Full registered name bank. ispb: ISPB code (Identificador Sistema de Pagamentos Brasileiros).

title: Get List of Banks in Brazil — get_brazil_banks
text: Requires internet connection. function pulls data real time BrasilAPI.

title: Get List of Banks in Brazil — get_brazil_banks

what: Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
title: Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
text: function retrieves detailed address information given Brazilian postal code (CEP) using BrasilAPI endpoint.

title: Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
text: cep valid Brazilian postal code (CEP) 8 digits (e.g., "89010025").

title: Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
text: data frame (tibble) following columns: cep: CEP (postal code). state: State abbreviation (e.g., SP, RJ). city: City municipality. neighborhood: Neighborhood. street: Street name. service: Name API service used.

title: Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
text: Example URL format: https://brasilapi.com.br/api/cep/v1/89010025 Replace 89010025 valid Brazilian postal code (CEP). function sends GET request BrasilAPI CEP endpoint. request successful response contains expected fields, returns structured tibble. Otherwise, message displayed NULL returned.

title: Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
text: Requires internet connection. Make sure CEP correctly formatted (digits, 8 characters).

title: Get Address Information by Brazilian CEP (Postal Code) — get_brazil_cep
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Look up information for a specific CEP get_brazil_cep("89010025") } # }

what: Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj
title: Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj
text: function retrieves public company registration data Brazil querying BrasilAPI endpoint.

title: Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj
Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj
text: cnpj valid CNPJ number string (digits, punctuation).

title: Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj
text: tibble selected essential fields: cnpj: CNPJ identifier. razao_social: Legal name. nome_fantasia: Trade name. capital_social: Registered capital (numeric). data_inicio_atividade: Start date activities. cnae_fiscal_descricao: Main economic activity. natureza_juridica: Legal nature. descricao_situacao_cadastral: Registration status. municipio: City. uf: State. cep: Postal code. logradouro: Address (street). numero: Address number. bairro: Neighborhood.

title: Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj
text: Example URL format: https://brasilapi.com.br/api/cnpj/v1/19131243000197 Replace 19131243000197 valid Brazilian CNPJ number. returns tibble essential information company's legal name, trade name, address, primary activity, registration status. function makes HTTP GET request BrasilAPI CNPJ endpoint processes JSON response structured tibble. returns fields essential informative user.

title: Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj
text: Requires internet connection. function returns NULL CNPJ invalid found.

title: Get Company Information by CNPJ (Brazil) — get_brazil_cnpj

title: Get Municipalities of a Brazilian State from IBGE — get_brazil_municipalities
text: data frame (tibble) following columns: nome: Name municipality. codigo_ibge: Official IBGE code municipality (character).

title: Get Municipalities of a Brazilian State from IBGE — get_brazil_municipalities
text: function sends GET request BrasilAPI IBGE endpoint. UF (state abbreviation) invalid recognized, function returns NULL appropriate message.

title: Get Municipalities of a Brazilian State from IBGE — get_brazil_municipalities
text: Requires internet access. Official IBGE codes widely used geostatistical analysis identification Brazilian municipalities.

what: Get Vehicle Brands from BrasilAPI (FIPE Data) — get_brazil_vehicle_brands
title: Get Vehicle Brands from BrasilAPI (FIPE Data) — get_brazil_vehicle_brands
text: function retrieves list vehicle brands Brazil using BrasilAPI endpoint, provides data sourced FIPE (Fundação Instituto de Pesquisas Econômicas). user must specify type vehicle: `"carros"`, `"motos"`, `"caminhoes"`.

title: Get Vehicle Brands from BrasilAPI (FIPE Data) — get_brazil_vehicle_brands
Get Vehicle Brands from BrasilAPI (FIPE Data) — get_brazil_vehicle_brands
text: tipo_veiculo string indicating type vehicle. Must one `"carros"`, `"motos"`, `"caminhoes"`.

title: Get Vehicle Brands from BrasilAPI (FIPE Data) — get_brazil_vehicle_brands
text: tibble (data frame) following columns: nome: Brand name. valor: FIPE code brand.

title: Get Vehicle Brands from BrasilAPI (FIPE Data) — get_brazil_vehicle_brands
text: function sends GET request BrasilAPI endpoint parses list vehicle brands. API returns error (e.g., invalid vehicle type), function return NULL.

title: Get Vehicle Brands from BrasilAPI (FIPE Data) — get_brazil_vehicle_brands
text: Requires internet connection. supports Brazilian vehicle types defined BrasilAPI.

title: Get Vehicle Brands from BrasilAPI (FIPE Data) — get_brazil_vehicle_brands
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Retrieve list of car brands cars <- get_brazil_vehicle_brands("carros") head(cars) } # }

what: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: Retrieves selected, essential information Brazil country full name. data retrieved REST Countries API. See API documentation https://restcountries.com/. Example API usage: https://restcountries.com/v3.1/name/brazil?fullText=true.

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: name Full country name (common official). example: "Brazil", "Peru", "France".

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: data frame 8 columns: name_common: Common name country. name_official: Official name country. capital: Capital city. region: Geographic region. subregion: Subregion. population: Total population. area: Total area square kilometers. languages: Official languages, separated commas.

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info
text: function returns readable details country's common official name, capital, region, subregion, population, area, official languages. function sends GET request REST Countries API. request successful (HTTP 200), parses JSON extracts key fields. country found error, function returns NULL user-friendly message.

title: Get Key Country Information from the REST Countries API — get_country_info

what: Monthly Average Heights of the Rio Negro at Manaus (1903–1992) — manaus_ts
title: Monthly Average Heights of the Rio Negro at Manaus (1903–1992) — manaus_ts
text: dataset, manaus_ts, univariate time series monthly average river heights Rio Negro Manaus. series contains 1080 observations spanning 90 years, January 1903 December 1992. value represents monthly average daily stages (heights) Rio Negro. Manaus located 18 km upstream confluence Rio Negro Amazon River, due minimal slope flatland affluents, measurements can considered good approximation water level confluence.

title: Monthly Average Heights of the Rio Negro at Manaus (1903–1992) — manaus_ts
Monthly Average Heights of the Rio Negro at Manaus (1903–1992) — manaus_ts
text: univariate time series class ts 1080 monthly observations 1903 1992: values Monthly average river heights (numeric)

title: Monthly Average Heights of the Rio Negro at Manaus (1903–1992) — manaus_ts
text: Data taken boot package version 1.3-31

title: Monthly Average Heights of the Rio Negro at Manaus (1903–1992) — manaus_ts
text: dataset name kept 'manaus_ts' avoid confusion datasets R ecosystem. naming convention helps distinguish dataset part BrazilDataAPI package assists users identifying specific characteristics. suffix 'ts' indicates dataset time series object. original content modified way.

what: Emission Factors from the Environmental Agency of São Paulo (CETESB) — sp_emission_factors_df
title: Emission Factors from the Environmental Agency of São Paulo (CETESB) — sp_emission_factors_df
text: dataset, sp_emission_factors_df, data frame containing emission factors Environmental Agency São Paulo (CETESB), including equivalencies European (EURO) vehicle emission standards. dataset includes 288 observations 10 variables, covering pollutants, vehicle age type, classification systems Proconve EURO light-duty heavy-duty vehicles.

title: Emission Factors from the Environmental Agency of São Paulo (CETESB) — sp_emission_factors_df
Emission Factors from the Environmental Agency of São Paulo (CETESB) — sp_emission_factors_df
text: data frame 288 observations 10 variables: Age Vehicle age (integer) Year Reference year (integer) Pollutant Pollutant type (character) Proconve_LDV Proconve classification light-duty vehicles (factor) t_Euro_LDV Temporal equivalence EURO light-duty vehicles (factor) Euro_LDV EURO standard classification light-duty vehicles (factor) Proconve_HDV Proconve classification heavy-duty vehicles (factor) Euro_HDV EURO standard classification heavy-duty vehicles (factor) PC_G Emission factor (numeric) LT Lifetime load factor (numeric)

title: Emission Factors from the Environmental Agency of São Paulo (CETESB) — sp_emission_factors_df
text: Data taken vein package version 1.1.3

title: Emission Factors from the Environmental Agency of São Paulo (CETESB) — sp_emission_factors_df
text: dataset name kept 'sp_emission_factors_df' avoid confusion datasets R ecosystem. naming convention helps distinguish dataset part BrazilDataAPI package assists users identifying specific characteristics. suffix 'df' indicates dataset data frame. original content modified way.

what: View Available Datasets in BrazilDataAPI — view_datasets_BrazilDataAPI
title: View Available Datasets in BrazilDataAPI — view_datasets_BrazilDataAPI
text: function lists datasets available 'BrazilDataAPI' package. 'BrazilDataAPI' package loaded, stops shows error message. datasets available, returns message empty vector.

title: View Available Datasets in BrazilDataAPI — view_datasets_BrazilDataAPI
View Available Datasets in BrazilDataAPI — view_datasets_BrazilDataAPI
text: character vector names available datasets.         datasets found, returns empty character vector.

title: View Available Datasets in BrazilDataAPI — view_datasets_BrazilDataAPI
code: if (requireNamespace("BrazilDataAPI", quietly = TRUE)) {   library(BrazilDataAPI)   view_datasets_BrazilDataAPI() } #> Datasets available in the 'BrazilDataAPI' package: #> [1] "Brasil_females_df"      "Brasil_males_df"        "Brazil_films_df"        #> [4] "Yellow_Fever_list"      "manaus_ts"              "sp_emission_factors_df"

what: Yellow Fever Outbreak in Brazil (Dec 2016 – May 2017) — Yellow_Fever_list
title: Yellow Fever Outbreak in Brazil (Dec 2016 – May 2017) — Yellow_Fever_list
text: dataset, Yellow_Fever_list, list object containing information flow Yellow Fever cases five Brazilian states outbreak period December 2016 May 2017. data include epidemiological statistics number cases, population, dates first last recorded cases, well travel-related matrices indicating disease importation exportation.
